IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: A VOLUNTEER ORGANIZATION THAT STRIVES TO IMPROVE LIVES IN LOCAL COMMUNITIES BY PARTNERING WITH MEMBER AGENCIES WHO PROVIDE SOCIAL SERVICES & PROGRAMS TO THOSE IN NEED; UNITED WAY OF MERCER COUNTY PROVIDES FUNDRAISING, ALLOCATION, & PLANNING SERVICES TO ITS MEMBER AGENCIES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: UNITED WAY OF MERCER COUNTY (THE "AGENCY") IS A NONPROFIT CORPORATION ORGANIZED UNDER THE LAWS OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA FOR THE PURPOSE OF FUNDRAISING, ALLOCATION, AND PLANNING SERVICES TO ITS MEMBER AGENCIES. THE AGENCY PROVIDES HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES TO THE RESIDENTS OF MERCER COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA AND ADJOINING AREAS.
IRS990.Description: PROVIDING FUNDRAISING AND PLANNING SERVICES FOR 30 "MEMBER AGENCIES" IN THE AREA. "MEMBER AGENCIES" ARE HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS.

Activity2.Description: THE AGENCY COORDINATES AND FUNDS "THE SUMMER PROGRAM FOR PRE-K - SUCCESS BY SIX", A COMMUNITY-WIDE EFFORT THAT SEEKS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF CHILDREN THROUGH EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT EDUCATION AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH VARIOUS PROGRAMS AND SERVICE PROVIDERS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: A LOCAL FOUNDATION CONTRIBUTED $5,000 TO CREATE A PERMANENT ENDOWMENT FUND. EARNINGS FROM THE ENDOWMENT FUND ARE ALLOWED TO BE USED FOR UNRESTRICTED PURPOSES.
TRANSFER OF FUNDS FROM UNITED WAY OF NORTHERN MERCER COUNTY: 6783.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: AMERICAN RED CROSS MERCER AND TRUMBULL COUNTIES

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE DISASTER, EMERGENCY & HEALTH, SAFETY & COMMUNITY SERVICE PROGRAMS
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR VOCATIONAL HABILITATION PROGRAM FOR PERSONS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, STEPS PROGRAM & PROVOCATIONAL CENTER EDUCATION & TRAINING PROGRAMS

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA FRENCH CREEK COUNCIL

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE CUB SCOUT PROGRAM FOR BOYS AGED 6-10
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR COMMUNITY RECREATION AT BRANDY SPRING PARK & ITS OPERATIONS & TO PROVIDE A MEANS TO PREVENT JUVENILE DELINQUENCY.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE RECREATIONAL, SOCIAL WELLNESS & EDCUATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR PEOPLE OF ALL AGES IN THE COMMUNITY.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PROFESSIONAL COUNSELING & ADOPTION SERVICES & OTHER SUPPORTIVE PROGRAMS.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PROGRAMS IMPROVING QUALITY OF LIFE FOR CHILDREN INCLUDING ADOPTION SERVICES, DAYCARE & FAMILY SUPPORTIVE SERVICES.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDES SPECIALIZED EDUCATION AND THERAPEUTIC SERVICES TO ALL CHILDREN IN MERCER COUNTY.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR OUTPATIENT PROGRAM HELPING INDIVIDUALS & FAMILLIES TO ATTAIN HEALTH & FULFILLNG LIVES.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR DAISY GIRL SCOUT PROGRAM FOR GIRLS IN KINDERGARTEN TO GRADE 3 DEVELOPING GIRLS CONFIDENCE, COURAGE & CHARACTER.
PROVIDES FUNDING CENTER'S FOOD PANTRY, EMERGENCY FOOD SERVICE & OCCUPANCY ASSISTANCE FOR ECONOMICALLY CHALLENGED OF GREATER GREENVILLE AREA.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR COMMUNITY RECREATION PROGRAMS FOR PEOPLE OF GREENVILLE & NORTHERN MERCER COUNTY.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR SUPPORT SERVICES FOR THE VISUALLY IMPAIRED & EDUCATIN& SCREENING PROGRAMS TO REDUCED INCIDENCE OF BLINDNESS.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: MENTAL HEALTH ASSOCIATION OF MERCER COUNTY INC

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ADVOCACY & EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR PERSONS WITH MENTAL ILLNESS & THEIR FAMILIES.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PUBLIC LIBRARY SERVICE SERVING INFORMATIONAL, EDUCATIONAL & RECREATION NEEDS OF MERCER & THE SURROUNDING AREAS.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR CASA PROGRAM WHOSE PURPOSE IS TO COMBAT JUVENILE DELINQUENCY & DEPENDENCY & CHILD ABUSE PREVENTION & COMMUNITY SERVICES.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR HOPE PROGRAM & EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE TO THOSE IN NEED.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR COMPREHENSIVE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM MEETING CRISIS NEEDS FOR LOW-INCOME FAMILIES.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR COMPREHENSIVE DIRECT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, EMERGENCY HOUSING SERVICES & SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT THROUGH IN-HOUSE FELLOWSHIP ACTIVITIES.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR SUMMER YOUTH PROGRAM, EMPLOYMENT COUNSELING PROGRAM & HOUSING/HOMELES ASSISTANCE TO ECONOMICALLY & SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED IN THE COMMUNITY.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR AFTER SCHOOL CHILDREN'S PROGRAM AND YOUTH DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM OF INSTRUCTIONAL CLASSES.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: THE LITERACY COUNCIL OF MERCER COUNTY

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: PROVIDES FUNDING FOR INSTRUCTION PROGRAMS FOR ADULTS & CHILDREN TO LEARN THE INFORMATION THEY NEED TO BECOME WELL INFORMED CITIZENS.
PROVIDES FUNDING FOR COMPREHENSIVE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM
PROVIDE FUNDING FOR ASSIST VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: WHEN APPLYING FOR GRANTS, EACH ORGANIZATION MUST SPECIFY INTENDED USE FOR THE FUNDS REQUESTED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FRANK AND LINDA EVANS (MARRIED) SERVE AS CAMPAIGN CO-CHAIRS. NEITHER HAVE VOTING RIGHTS AT BOARD MEETINGS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A COPY OF THE 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR TO REVIEW WITH THE BOARD BEFORE IT IS FILED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A REVIEW AND APPROVAL ARE CONDUCTED IN A SESSION OF THE BOARD WITHOUT SAID EMPLOYEES PRESENT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Upon request to executive director at United Way office.
